name: African spear sansevieria
description: Dracaena angolensis (syn. Sansevieria cylindrica), commonly known as African Spear or Cylindrical Snake Plant, is a succulent native to Angola. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and features upright, cylindrical, gray-green leaves (60-120 cm tall, 2-3 cm in diameter) arranged in a fan-like rosette. The plant displays an upright, columnar growth habit. It produces small, white to greenish flowers on a spike, though flowering is rare in cultivation. In its native habitat, it grows in well-draining, sandy soils in semi-arid regions. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds architectural interest with its distinctive cylindrical leaves. It's popular among succulent enthusiasts for its unique form and low maintenance requirements.
careTips: Allow substrate to dry completely between waterings
Bright, indirect light preferred (tolerates low light)
